workflow.name: 0006 - SCA - Quarantine AWS Instances from Alerts
workflow.title: 0006 - SCA - Quarantine AWS Instances from Alerts

properties.name: Secure Cloud Analytics API Key
properties.description: API connection string for Secure Cloud Analytics. For example: "email@domain.com:api_key_here". This is essentially the "Connection String" you can copy from the SCA portal without the "ApiKey " prefix. You can generate or regenerate an API key on your user page in your Secure Cloud Analytics portal. If you already have an API key for SCA in a global variable, use the group at the beginning of the workflow to set this variable to the global variable's value

properties.name: Webex Room ID
properties.description: The ID of the Webex room to post messages to. If you'd rather provide a room name, leave this blank and set the "Webex Room Name" local variable instead

properties.name: AWS Region
properties.description: The name of your AWS region

properties.name: Webex Access Token
properties.description: The access token to use to authenticate to the Webex API. Information about using a bot, which is what we recommend, can be found here: https://developer.webex.com/docs/bots

properties.name: Webex Room Name
properties.description: The name of the Webex room to post messages to. If you'd rather provide a room ID, leave this blank and set the "Webex Room ID" local variable instead

properties.name: Webex Text
properties.description: Placeholder for the text to send via Webex. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: CIDR IP to Exclude
properties.description: This CIDR network will be excluded from SSH restrictions and will still be able to access the instances in the security group. If you only want to allow a single IP, just add the IP with /32 for the mask like this: "192.168.1.100/32"

This workflow fetches "Geographically Unusual Remote Access" alerts from the Cisco Secure Cloud Analytics (SCA) API for the past hour. For each alerts, it looks for a matching Amazon Web Services (AWS) instance and restrict SSH access to its security group. Notifications are sent using Webex and an approval is requested to lift the quarantine restrictions.

Documentation: https://ciscosecurity.github.io/sxo-05-security-workflows/workflows/0006

Target Group: Default TargetGroup

Targets: Amazon Web Services, Secure Cloud Analytics, Webex Teams

Steps:
[] Fetch Geographically Unusual Remote Access alerts from SCA for the past hour
[] For each alert:
[]> Check if the instance was already quarantined (if so, skip it)
[]> Get information from AWS and extract security group
[]> Revoke SSH access and add an exception for the CIDR network in the local variable
[]> Create an approval request to remove the instance from quarantine
[]> Send a Webex notification
